title: I think I know why Riot's auto-ban system seems to only work sometimes.
body:
Honestly, whenever you report someone and you get that nifty little box saying 'ey some dude just got the smackdown 'cos he was a bitch' you're rock hard the entire time. You can't tell me otherwise. I think if everyone you reported got banned it'd lose some of its impact.

Or maybe on a more logical side it only gives you that box every now and again, or if the account actually gets perma'd, or every 4th person that gets punished because of your report, etc.

_Shrug._

replies.body: During testing they had it so that you'd get a notification whenever your report contributed to a sanction, but they quickly realized it was unbearably spammy since people would be gettting several notifications every other game. That's why they decided to restrict the pop-up for only the people who last reported them.
Bronze 5 is the promise land im trying to tank my mmr to there without getting banned by playing my garbo champs

There is literally no reason to intentionally lose and ruin other people's games just so that you can be like 'lololol look bronze v guize'. It's especially frustrating as someone who went 7-3 in placements (S- minimum basically every game, 5.0kds and highest damage to champions like 90% of the time) just to get slapped into bronze v because Riot's new placement system is kinda garbo. I don't understand the appeal.

Who said im intentionally trying to lose? I said im trying to get to bronze 5 by playing champions im bronze 5 with
It only shows up if the guy is banned because of YOUR report.

They're not trying to get you hard, they're trying to clean their game. It's simply that not every report has a consequence. Even if someone blatantly fed and spammed profanity, if it was an isolated incident, there won't be a punishment. The other day I straight up left a game before it began in the loading screen, I didn't receive so much as a "Hey, leaving is bad". Why? I'm an isolated case. I never do it. Same for your reports. The ones that go through are because that person has a history. No message, no history/offense wasn't bad enough.

This was more half satirical, but yeah I understand sometimes people just tilt super hard flame for an entire game and then alt-f4 and go for a walk or something. Personally, in the last two weeks I've gotten than box like 7 times. Silver's a bitch I tell ya. Seems even worse since 3's has a habit of not taking 5's MMR into account and bronze/silver face off against plats and the like. Never seen so much toxicity except for when a plat beats a bronze like 'yeah learn your place'.

~~I mean, Bronze V after going 7-3 in placements is a bitch too. Kinda why I gave up on solo/duo.~~
